keyword: how many calories are in orange chicken
title: How Many Calories Are in Orange Chicken?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in orange chicken per serving, including carbs, protein, fat, sodium details, and easy tweaks for lower calories.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Orange Chicken?
assumptions: Standard restaurant-style serving (~200 g); breaded, deep-fried chicken in sweet orange sauce; includes batter and glaze.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by restaurant, recipe, portion size, and preparation (fried vs. baked); check menus or labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One serving of orange chicken has about 520 kcal, with high carbs from the sauce and moderate protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged or restaurant info.

tweaks.label: Baked instead of fried (reduces oil absorption)
Less sauce (half the glaze per serving)
Add steamed broccoli (1 cup, low-cal filler)

faqs.q: How many calories are in a serving of orange chicken?
faqs.a: Approximately 520 kcal for a standard 200 g restaurant serving.

faqs.q: Is orange chicken high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, about 900 mg per serving due to sauce and batterâ€”watch if on a low-sodium diet.

faqs.q: How much protein in orange chicken?
faqs.a: Around 28 g per serving, mainly from the chicken pieces.

faqs.q: Why is orange chicken so caloric?
faqs.a: Deep-frying and sugary sauce contribute most; carbs from batter and glaze add up quickly.

faqs.q: Can I make lower-calorie orange chicken at home?
faqs.a: Yes, bake the chicken and use less sugar in sauce to cut ~100 kcal per serving.
